issue.subject: [DASHBOARD] Compatibility with php 5.3

journals.notes:
Hi,

I agree with Thomas about PHP 5.3 compliance for all easySDI extensions.
The Joomla minimal technical requirements http://www.joomla.org/technical-requirements.html is very valuable, and such information described into easySDI technical guidelines.
It implies that all easySDI 3.x extensions should be compliant at least with PHP 5.3.1

For information, our internal development environment is based on PHP 5.3 to follow Joomla technical requirements.
Most important point seems to document such technical guidelines :-)

I agree we should follow Joomla minimal requirements AND that we shoud add this informnation to the WIKI here :
https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/4
OK for PHP 5.3, but we'll have to ensure that code is also portable on 5.4 without _deprecated_ warning etc...

To ensure compliance with PHP version greater than minimal requirements, the easySDI source code should dynamically detect PHP version (function phpversion) and switch case the PHP function used. Is it right or do you think to anything else ?

According to this, the question is which upper version than the minimal one should be supported for all the easySDI PHP code ?
Should the target be aligned with the Joomla Recommended requirements ? In our case easySDI extension should be compliant with PHP 5.3.1+ and 5.4.x but not 5.5.x ?

Thanks to Thomas for fixing such problem which is now available in V4.
I open a new POST on easySDI Forums related to our last notes finding the best process to adopt...
